attributes.action: Ban All Commercial Flights On Sundays
attributes.background: Take the lessons learnt from the inflicted global shutdown to benefit the planet and prevent further global warming and pollution by banning all commercial flying on Sundays.
attributes.additional_details:
The Coronavirus is a global tragedy, on all levels personal, social and economically.  However, we are already seeing the incredible benefits to the environment. 

What mustn't happen is for Covid-19 to come, kill, destroy and leave without us learning from the tragedies that have occurred. Lets recognise the benefits of global shutdown on the environment, how it's helping heal our world and make changes for the better.  One day a week of no commercial flying would allow the planet to breathe.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Ban non-biodegradable cling film to help the environment
attributes.background: Plastic cling film harms our environment. It should be banned from being sold by all retailers. Biodegradable cling film should be the only cling film available.
attributes.additional_details:
Cling film that cannot decompose harms our environment and furthermore, cling film that enters our shorelines and seas can be mistaken by fish and other marine wildlife as food which is harmful for them.
 
The Government should ban retailers from selling non-biodegradable cling film so that they are only able to sell cling film that is biodegradable, to help reduce damage to wildlife in our seas and in our countryside and valleys.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Add mental health training to teaching courses
attributes.background: All adults who want to work in a school environment must have mental health training added into their 3-4 year course at University to help children and teenagers in a mainstream education environment who have mental health issues or illnesses.
attributes.additional_details: Many children/teenagers suffer from mental health. As the young person advances into secondary school/college the rules are much stricter and punishments are given out for minor reasons. This can make some people with mental health issues feel scared, anxious and may lead to avoidance in going. Teachers/tutors don't have an understanding in mental health and how to help young people in difficult situations, so Universities must teach useful ways to help young people who struggle more than others

departments.name: Department for Education

attributes.action: Reduced VAT on plastic-free products
attributes.background: Plastic is causing more & more problems to the environment, and we need to act now. I want to see a plastic-free Britain and planet,
attributes.additional_details: If we reduce the cost to the public on plastic-free products, then public behaviour will change. We believe the best way to do this is by reducing VAT on plastic free products.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: We need a right to repair in all electronic devices for a minimum of 10 years.
attributes.background: Following a recent visit to an Apple store with an electronic device (iPad) that was only just over 1 year old, the back plate of the device needed replacing. The device is in perfect working order, but has very small damage to the metal back plate. Only option presented - buy a new one at £900.
attributes.additional_details: Companies are forcing customers to spend money on brand new products to make more money rather than charging a nominal fee for repair. It’s also extremely damaging to the environment to be constantly making people buy new devices when simple repairs could be made to prolong the life of the existing item.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Help protect our environment by permanently banning unnecessary travel to work
attributes.background: The Government should require all workers to work from home unless they are unable to do so. People can be significantly healthier and happier working from home, and banning all unnecessary travel to work should benefit both the environment and our mental health.
attributes.additional_details:
The coronavirus outbreak, and associated restrictions on movement, has resulted in large numbers of people working from home. This has allowed many to save money, catch up on sleep, and spend more time with their families.
 
Reduced activity, particularly commuting, resulting from coronavirus has had substantial environmental benefits. Air quality has improved dramatically in many areas, and much wildlife has been able to flourish.
 
This is the best time to make permanent changes and move forward.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Exclude plant-based materials from the plastic tax
attributes.background:
The UK is quite sensibly looking at the impact of petrol-based plastics & the impact it has on the environment so we welcome the future plastic tax the Government has planned for 2022
We are amazed to find that the solution, make them from plants not petrol, is not excluded from the tax.
attributes.additional_details:
The current Government response is that in order for companies like ours to avoid the tax, we need to add 30% recycled plastics but for very obvious reasons, this is not an answer.

While the rest of the world realises that we don't need to change how we live, just give the consumer a natural alternative, the UK is rushing ahead with a policy that is at odds with the intention of minimising the amount of petrol-based plastics.

We want the Government to reconsider it's current approach

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Ban liquid plastic in cosmetics.
attributes.background: Microbeads have been banned. The same needs to happen to liquid plastic used in shampoo, soap, hand creams etc. This product cannot be filtered out so could be entering the food chain.
attributes.additional_details: This cannot be good for us, wildlife or the environment.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Hold COBR meetings to address the climate emergency
attributes.background: The House of Commons declared a climate emergency. COBR meetings must be held to deal with the national crisis and catastrophic disruption it will bring for people, nature, society, and environment. Action is needed now to deal with the crisis to stop fossil fuels and protect/restore nature.
attributes.additional_details: Greenhouse gases are pouring into the atmosphere at catastrophic rates and action is needed now. Current ambition is not enough. We depend on nature, but are destroying it at an alarming rate and it is in crisis. Pollution is engulfing the planet, but polluters are not paying for destruction. Current Committees are not acting at sufficient pace, or influencing action as an emergency! New plans with innovators, entrepreneurs, financiers, environmentalists, are needed to transform to a circular economy.

departments.name: Cabinet Office

attributes.action: Don't ease the lockdown until at least 60-70% of the population is vaccinated.
attributes.background: Do not give in to libertarian political pressure to ease the lockdown too soon as this could undo the gains made against the Covid-19 virus and lead to more deaths. Heed the expert advice. Recognise the salient and repeated lesson of this crisis: A healthy economy is dependent on a healthy nation.
attributes.additional_details: We must give the vaccines the chance they deserve to achieve a level of herd immunity, not the give the virus the opportunity to outwit science by encouraging an environment conducive to transmission and further mutations. Life matters, the economy matters, livelihoods matter - easing the lockdown a day too soon would mean more loss of life, more lockdown and ultimately more damage to livelihoods and the economy. Too soon would be deadly, short-termist and a false economy.

departments.name: Cabinet Office

attributes.action: Disability awareness at all levels of national curriculum to prevent bullying
attributes.background: Children have a lack of understanding around disabilities, I think this is why some children are bullied for having a disability. Make it compulsory for children to be taught about it and why people may have it. This will help children understand and also help stop children feeling isolated.
attributes.additional_details: There have been serious cases of bullying for disabilities such as autism, including where children have been hurt or have suffered serious mental health problems as a result. These children are our future - we have to teach children it’s wrong to bully for being different and make them understand it, and the best place is a school environment. Make it a compulsory lesson for all age groups.

departments.name: Department for Education

attributes.action: Seek to improve the safety and ecological-soundness of pesticide use globally
attributes.background: I would like the Government to work internationally to seek to reduce and remedy use of harmful pesticides globally. Some pesticides can be bad for our health, the environment and economy - they affect wildlife and cause health issues. The UK and its partners can start to improve practices.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should work with other countries to put pesticide use on an ecological footing. This should include influence through trade deals, to agree world standards to create a healthier and more sustainable economy. Some pesticides increase the risks of cancers and foetal abnormalities. Crop pollinating is worth up to $600 billion globally and insects are important to our gardens and natural spaces. Our human needs are met by natural resources. We need others to accept this.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Give consumers a statutory right to opt out of receiving paper correspondence
attributes.background: Too many businesses routinely send paper-based correspondence to their customers, which unnecessarily harms the environment, instead of using e-mail. Please give consumers the right to opt to receive all correspondence electronically from each business with whom they have a contractual relationship.
attributes.additional_details: Paper correspondence is not only harmful to the environment, but it is also onerous for consumers, because it needs to be either stored or shredded. There is no good reason why, for example, banks and credit card issuers notify their customers of changes to terms and conditions by paper, while supplying statements electronically. Only physical goods or physical objects, e.g. credit or debit cards, should be sent by post. The same principle applies to other sectors that similarly waste paper.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Ban the use of plastic gloves at petrol stations
attributes.background: Plastic gloves, used in petrol stations, end up in bushes, trees, fields. They can reach rivers, lakes and oceans. Banning their use at petrol stations should help reduce harm to the environment.
attributes.additional_details: These plastic gloves are strewn over our green belt and protected nature reserve areas. They can be extremely dangerous to plants, animals and insects & end up in water ways and ultimately breakdown and can enter the human food chain. These plastics can be incredibly hard to collect as they blow around.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban plastic and foil balloon releases and fund memorial forests instead
attributes.background: Thousands of balloons are released into the towns & countryside of the UK every year..
attributes.additional_details:
These balloons pollute, can endanger farm animals, and do not decompose. They serve zero purpose in assisting the environment and it goes without saying that despite sentimental intention they can actually cause harm.

If the Government funded the planting of trees in memory of loved ones, perhaps people would have memorial forests to visit during their own lifetimes instead of two minutes of a balloon release and nothing to show for it.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban the advertisement of plastic and non-recyclable toys to children
attributes.background: Regulate which kinds of products can be advertised directly to children (e.g. during kids TV Ad Breaks) to ensure that items made from plastic and non-recyclable materials are not advertised to children.
attributes.additional_details: Plastics are a major part of climate crisis. They can take thousands of years to break down, polluting our environment especially our oceans. When we are actively trying to move towards a greener & more sustainable society it makes no sense to continue heavily promoting plastic toys to our children. If these ads were banned there would be an incentive for this industry to use more sustainable alternatives to produce their products & packaging, the next generation should be encouraged away from plastic.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Require all newly built homes to be Carbon Neutral by 2030
attributes.background: The Government should require all new build homes to be Carbon Neutral, using eco materials, solar panels, and planting trees etc. All materials/resources should have their carbon impact measure and then offset by appropriate means.
attributes.additional_details: Land is being purchased and built on at an alarming rate. Animals are losing their habitats and very little is being done to combat the carbon which will be absorbed by these trees/ fields which are being dug up. Builders should be made responsible for combating the additional carbon which will be released into the environment. The increase in new houses is also linked to the increase in quarries and mining which also increases carbon emission.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Add green infrastructure as a nationally significant project to the Planning Act
attributes.background: The Planning Act is heavily focused on infrastructure, such as road, rail and energy. We need legislation that enables conservation bodies (Environment Agency, Natural England) to apply for planning consent, including compulsory acquisition, for green infrastructure for the good of the nation.
attributes.additional_details: Green infrastructure is a planned network of natural and semi-natural spaces with other environmental features designed to deliver a range of ecosystem services. The Government should do this to promote importance of the UK environment and conservation in its national planning. At present, the legislation is centred around mitigation, when there should be a greater promotion of new green infrastructure. It should be up to the planning authority to determine whether there is a 'Case for the Scheme' in the interest to the public. Currently there is no mechanism for green infrastructure schemes to come forward and be assessed.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Ban cigarettes - The Largest Ocean Polluter
attributes.background: In April 2021 England will officially ban the single use plastics such as straws and cotton buds. Wales will also do the same in Spring 2021. However the largest source of single use plastic pollution is cigarettes. Therefore it would be appropriate to also ban cigarettes.
attributes.additional_details: The Government have agreed to ban single use plastic in 2021, however the list of items banned crucially misses out cigarettes. Cigarettes are the top single use plastic polluter in the world! On top of the plastic and microplastics issue, cigarettes also add harmful chemicals such as nicotine, lead and arsenic into the environment. These chemicals enter our food chain leading to bioaccumulation. They have also been shown to inhibit plant growth on land and reduce crop yeilds.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Fund free public transport for work-related travel by emergency services workers
attributes.background: The Government should fund free public transport for members of the emergency service workers (Police, Fire, Ambulance, and Coastguard) for work-related travel, i.e when in uniform to or from a shift.
attributes.additional_details: The cost of living is increasing heavily, and as emergency service workers are public sector workers, they are unlikely to get a pay rise in line with inflation. The provision of free public transport would really help emergency service workers with the cost of living, as well has being beneficial to the environment by incentivising these workers to travel by public transport as opposed to road.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Impose high import tariffs on goods not certified as sustainably sourced
attributes.background: The UK government should place high import taxes on goods derived from activities which damage the environment e.g. Brazilian animal feed, wood, meat from land which was previously rainforest, the destruction of which threatens significant environmental changes with dire global consequences.
attributes.additional_details:
Environmental destruction should not be profitable. When we buy the products of environmental damage we encourage and perpetuate the problem.
 
To shift U.K. consumption to sustainable activities we should make it expensive to import items, the creation of which threatens our safety due to the damage it has made to our environment.
 
When we stop paying for goods produced through activities which destroy the planet, these activities will stop.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Commit to electrification of the whole East West Rail line & ban diesel on route
attributes.background: Place the environment and sustainable transport at the forefront of the East West Rail project and commit to ensuring that the whole of the project is electrified at the outset and that diesel cannot be used to fuel trains along the entire route.
attributes.additional_details:
“Electric trains are better for the environment than diesel trains, and they’re quieter for both those on board ... and those living close to the railway" (Network Rail who are undertaking significant work to electrify rails to meet the government's target of taking all diesel only trains off the track by 2040)

Failure to commit to this now risks severe disruption to the local habitats and communities not once but twice before the end of the next decade as well as decreasing air quality.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Make it illegal to allow pets to roam freely outdoors
attributes.background: Make it illegal for owners of pets including cats to allow them to roam freely beyond their property. If owners want their cats to go into the garden, they could install overhead net fencing or a catio. #TheFluffyLawUK
attributes.additional_details: Cats are often unable to protect themselves from the environment, contributing to approx. 230,000 cat deaths each year from road traffic. This could be prevented if our cats were kept inside and restricted to our gardens. It could also protect the environment in so many ways by keeping our cats restricted - it should prevent them being a nuisance & should help stop over-breeding, protect birds & keeps them from being attacked by other people.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Require local authorities to collect all plastic waste that can be recycled
attributes.background: At present many councils do not accept some recyclable plastics because they have not arranged recycling facilities for these. The Government should require councils to collect all recyclable plastics and make arrangements for these to be recycled.
attributes.additional_details:
Local recycling collections are accessible to everyone. A lot of people can't easily get to alternative recycling facilities.

This should reduce plastic going to landfill – it takes centuries to degrade – and production of virgin plastics, helping to reduce the impact of plastic waste on the environment.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Make ASD and ADHD screening available to all children of nursery age
attributes.background: Making ASD/ADHD screenings universally available should mean fewer children go undiagnosed until adulthood and receive any help they may need to thrive in a school and work environments.
attributes.additional_details:
Many go undiagnosed for a very long time, which can mean people with ASD or ADHD do not receive the support they need to thrive, and can exacerbate mental health issues.
 
Society is not built for neurodivergent people, but with this change we can help make it a more friendly place to live for everybody.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Plant one native tree for each UK resident to commemorate the Queen’s Jubilee.
attributes.background: To commemorate the Queen’s Jubilee the UK Government should provide resources for a tree planting programme to plant a native tree for each UK resident (at least 5% to be oak, beech or elm) in a patchwork across England.
attributes.additional_details: As a fitting and long lasting tribute to the Queen for decades of service to the country, to benefit the national environment, assist in the battle against climate change and to foster enthusiasm across the country for planting trees.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Fund initiatives to recycle PPE waste
attributes.background: The pandemic has completely reshaped our priorities, we have become dependant on the use of PPE to protect ourselves from the dangers posed by Covid 19. How this PPE is discarded however poses a significant threat to the environment and our climate. The Government must enable recycling of PPE.
attributes.additional_details: In response to this, I propose the Government provide funding for PPE recycling schemes, with facilities made available for public use. This could include PPE recycling positioned outside a variety of supermarkets in the UK. This would better enable a return from this pandemic sustainably. The government can make real change in enabling the country to better dispose of its PPE.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Create visitation rights for siblings full, step or half
attributes.background: Please create rights for siblings full, step or half to visit one another. Some siblings are split from divorce, others from the moment they were born and it isn’t fair that the legal parent/guardian has the right to revoke visitation from one sibling to another as though they were a friend
attributes.additional_details: These rights between siblings to visit one another without the need of consent from a parent or guardian should only be revoked by court order if it is deemed an unsafe environment for either sibling and should also be a fineable offence if the parent or guardian attempts to revoke visitation rights between siblings it’s not fair that siblings have to suffer due to disagreements between parents or between the step parents and another sibling.

departments.name: Ministry of Justice

attributes.action: Fund councils to provide more accessible and secure cycle lanes
attributes.background: The Government should fund local authorities to improve the accessibility and security of cycle lanes, as we have seen an increase in traffic-related incidents involving cyclists in recent years. Investing in infrastructure related to cycle paths could help us with the issue we are facing.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2019 16,884 cyclists were injured in road accidents, Including 4,433 who were seriously injured or killed.

Although car occupants account for the greatest number of casualties each year, this is unsurprising as cars account for 80% of trips over 5 miles in Britain. By looking at casualty rates in terms of the number of casualties per mile travelled, pedal cyclists fall into the ‘vulnerable road users’ category, along with pedestrians and motorcyclists, who have much higher casualty rates per mile travelled than other road users.

We want the Government to invest in more cycle lanes as it would surely help traffic and cycle-related incidents decrease, and make cycle lanes more accessible therefore creating a more safe environment for cyclists.
Do you now think it’s time for change?

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Make remote working, where possible, a statutory employment right
attributes.background: The government should make it so that remote working requests must be honoured as standard and only in cases where it is impossible for the job to be done remotely should the request be denied. By making it a requestable right, only those who it would suit would access it.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a massive push to get more people back into the office, I feel this is a backward step. Remote working opens up employment to numerous groups who are currently unable to access it, from parents with childcare issues to the disabled who may struggle in an in office environment. 

Remote working also has many potential advantages to both employers and employees, including but not only:

- Better work/life balance
- Financial benefits
- Increased productivity
- Improved staff health and wellbeing

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Make mental safety equal at work with physical safety
attributes.background: Require Mental Health Injuries be included in the prescribed ‘reportable incidents’ listed in the RIDDOR regime and appropriate Health and Safety Executive resources allocated to the preventative inspection and investigation of reported cases.
attributes.additional_details:
The Health and Safety at Work Act requires: “the provision and maintenance of a working environment for his employees that is, so far as is reasonably practicable ... adequate as regards ... arrangements for their welfare at work.”

Despite this, mental Injuries aren't reportable under RIDDOR  because  “stress-related conditions usually result from a prolonged period of pressure, often from many factors, rather than just one distinct event”.

This is inconsistent with e.g. cancers.

departments.name: Department for Work and Pensions

attributes.action: Nationalise water companies
attributes.background: Nationalise water companies and invest in improving the antiquated infrastructure,  particularly the sewage system.  Protect our waterways and reservoirs and lakes and ensure that they are in good ecological condition and safe for people to use and enjoy.
attributes.additional_details: Water companies are placing profit before protecting the environment.  Last year 1.5m hours of raw sewage were pumped into English rivers. Action is not being taken to prevent our waterways being polluted. Part of the problem is a sewage system which does not seem to be fit for purpose. If water was back in public ownership it would be easier to ensure that rivers were not being polluted  and would also help to mitigate against flooding.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Increase tax on private flights
attributes.background: Significantly increase taxes on private flights, to discourage use of private flights and to encourage use of more sustainable and less environmentally damaging modes of transport.
attributes.additional_details: Do this to help protect the environment by  promoting positive behaviour to reduce carbon emissions to address the climate change emergency.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Make schools allow GCSE students to take study leave before & during their exams
attributes.background: Make it compulsory for schools to give their GCSE students a option to take study leave. So a students full potential isn't limited because of a classroom environment.
attributes.additional_details: It gives students a chance to spend more time studying than they would normally be able to in the average school day. Students are given the chance to work independently and study without supervision or pressure. This means that students can achieve higher grades overall, due to addition revision time and helps students to identify and work on their revision to what suits them best.

departments.name: Department for Education

attributes.action: Retain full benefits for parents facing temporary removal of their children
attributes.background: Currently, parents who have children temporarily removed by children's social care face sanctions in their benefits. This is an additional and unnecessary burden on parents attempting to get their children returned to them. Benefits should remain fixed until final arrangements for children are made.
attributes.additional_details: Poverty is endemic and impacts the lives of millions of families in the UK. Additional financial hardship for parents who have had their children temporarily removed by children's services is unfair and counterproductive to the principles of always seeking reunification for children with their birth families. This must change systemically to give all parents a fairer chance to create and sustain environments to support their children returning to them.

departments.name: Department for Work and Pensions

attributes.action: Abolish VAT on all Electric Vehicles.
attributes.background: Government should exempt electric vehicles from VAT.
attributes.additional_details: Government’s plug-in grant up to £2500 toward the electric cars are not enough. Government  would need to take drastic steps to tackle global warming and for cleaner environment. Scraping VAT on electric vehicles would make Electric vehicles more affordable and it should encourage business and public to choose Electric vehicle over the Diesel or Petrol.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Run a public awareness campaign to reduce energy and resource consumption
attributes.background: I want the Government to run a national public awareness campaign encouraging people to reduce energy and resource consumption. This should call on people to:
attributes.additional_details:
*Turn the tap off when brushing teeth
*Stop eating fish to help save the environment
*Turn power off when phones charged
 
Because as one person I lack the power and resources to reach every home and every person with this message before it's too late, but the Government can.
 
The Government needs to act on behalf of the world and be its voice, and encourage all citizens to act responsibly.
 
The Government has the power to make the world a better place for the future of mankind, but also the power to make it worse. How you choose to act now will determine which one of those it is!

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ensure DWP letters are sent in Manilla (brown) rather than white envelopes.
attributes.background: DWP announced that they were about to start sending out letters to benefit claimants in white envelopes rather than the familiar brown (manilla envelopes) this will cause a great deal of anxiety and confusion to claimants who are used to looking for 'brown' envelopes for benefit enquiries.
attributes.additional_details: My fear is that people will not be able to open the white envelopes routinely as they are not used to them and may well feel that they are something equally as fearful to people with anxieties such as bills.  Important letters will not be opened and the very most vulnerable of our society may end up with sanctions or losing their benefits through fear of opening mail.  Also, this must be bad for the environment in terms of using white paper rather than brown paper which doe not need bleaching.

departments.name: Department for Work and Pensions

attributes.action: Ban bonfires during daylight hours
attributes.background: Ban any bonfire from occurring before dusk. Bonfires create excessive smoke which has an impact on the quality of air for the community. Everyone is entitled to fresh air and should be able to enjoy their garden.
attributes.additional_details: Bonfires can cause breathing difficulties and are particularly dangerous for anyone suffering with health conditions such as asthma, and can be a risk to the health of children and the elderly. It is also a strain on our emergency services when fires get out of control, and a strain on the environment when clothes need rewashing.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Ban the use of disposable BBQs and campfires on moorland
attributes.background: Make the use of disposable BBQs and campfires illegal on moorland in order to avoid devastating wildfires. Marsden Moor is not alone in seeing a number of huge wildfires over the last three years caused by the use of disposable bbqs, firecrackers and campfires.
attributes.additional_details: Wildfires are one of the biggest threats to our Moorland. Climate change, irresponsible behaviour and the use of disposable bbqs have led to an increase in these distressing events. Firefighters and volunteers are being asked to risk their lives to battle these fires in terrifying conditions and local communities are seeing their environment being destroyed Our wildlife is being devastated. Nesting birds are being forced to abandon their eggs and mass habitat destruction is occurring.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban unaccompanied adults from all childrens' play areas.
attributes.background: To make a public playground a safe place for children to be in. No one over the age of 18+ can enter a public playground without accompanying a child between the ages of 0-16 years. this is to create a safe environment for our children. excluding people over the ages of 18 with disabilities
attributes.additional_details:
This is due to  incidents of adults praying on young children in public playgrounds.

Furthermore i have personally encountered adults being in playground without children of their own watching my daughter, trying to beckon her over and film her. children should be safe to play without the threat of this kind.

departments.name: Department for Education

attributes.action: Ban unsolicited mail where a “no junk mail” sign is displayed
attributes.background: We would like the Government to make it illegal to, and impose fines for, posting unsolicited mail through letterboxes that display a “no junk mail” sign. This ban should include all forms of advertising such as leaflets, flyers, magazines, free papers and take away menus.
attributes.additional_details:
It would be more cost effective and better for the environment to only deliver to people who wish to receive advertising.
 
Some have made requests to the individual companies to stop posting their marketing material, but the companies do not always comply with the request and continue to post their material. No means No, and all companies should respect a persons’ wishes if they have a sign on their letterbox saying ‘no junk mail’.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Make online abuse of disabled people a specific criminal offence
attributes.background: The Government should create new laws to better protect people with mental health issues / disabilities from being bullied / harassed online. This should include making online abuse of disabled people a specific criminal offence.
attributes.additional_details: I have autism and BPD, and have been badly bullied throughout my life both in school / workplaces / online environment. I have put up with it until now and will make a stand against it. I want the backing of the Government to help make a new law to protect disabled people from the effects of bullying.

departments.name: Department for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport

attributes.action: Legalise and incentivise uptake of personal electric vehicles
attributes.background: I would like the Government to legalise and create incentives to promote uptake of all personal, micro powered, more carbon efficient vehicles. This could help reduce carbon emissions from personal transport.
attributes.additional_details: This is an issue that requires swift action to take a global lead in changing travel behaviours. Both for global environment and local pollution. The costs of this damage are on record. And in the current fuel and cost of living crisis, many lives could be improved and cities made less polluted and provided with a more mobile work force. We believe the environmental, social and commercial benefits are clear.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Require search engines to remove bestiality images and websites from results
attributes.background: The Government should regulate search engines and require them to remove images and websites of bestiality abuse from their search results. Bestiality is illegal under UK law but currently sites and hundreds of images can be returned in searches. These should be censored to dissuade animal abuse.
attributes.additional_details: Without the UK Government & opposition MPs enforcing these prohibitions on search engines and results it gives an appearance of an unenforced law. This in turn perpetuates an environment for ease of access which subsequently results in more and more animal abuse while more content is created. Furthermore, this content will be especially dangerous in developing minds.

departments.name: Department for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport

attributes.action: Remove recommendation that face coverings be used in classrooms
attributes.background: Remove the wording referring to secondary schools from section 92 of the "Covid-19 Response - Spring 21" document; in which the recommended use of face coverings in Higher Education, Further Education and secondary schools is extended to all indoor environments - including classrooms.
attributes.additional_details:
Attendance at secondary school is compulsory in this country. If the recommendation is adopted, pupils could have no choice about wearing a face covering for many hours, possibly the entire school day, with no opportunity for a break.

Skin irritation from face coverings and therefore face touching can increase with time. Incorrect wearing and the wearing of the same mask for several days renders the measure ineffective.

We believe this recommendation is therefore inhumane, discriminatory and ineffective.

departments.name: Department for Education

attributes.action: Introduce a Winter fuel payment for all parents home-schooling during lockdown.
attributes.background: As children are forced into home-schooling during the national lockdown, parents will face higher heating bills due to keeping homes warm for longer periods. Direct payments to suppliers or vouchers that can be redeemed for meters will help ensure children are kept warm during these cold months.
attributes.additional_details:
Many parents, not just those entitled to benefits, are already struggling financially and simply cannot afford increased heating costs. 
Whilst home-schooling, our children are expected to sit for extended periods whilst participating in live, on-line and desk based lessons. At school, children are used to warm classroom environments and it is essential that our children are afforded the same comfort at home so that they can focus on their education.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Require schools to teach about environmental conservation
attributes.background: The curriculum should be changed to require schools to teach kids about the negative effects of human activity on the planet and what they can do as individuals to help prevent this and conserve the environment. Currently this can be taught in science lessons but isn’t required.
attributes.additional_details: I believe the generation being brought up today does not realise the affect their everyday actions have upon the environment all over the world. This education would help them understand how minor changes to their lifestyles can help to preserve the environment. This education would also create a generational awareness to make a change which hopefully will be passed down.

departments.name: Department for Education

attributes.action: Provide funding for local initiatives to establish COVID-19 memorial arboretums.
attributes.background: I call on the government to liaise with charities and establish a central fund to provide grants of up to £50,000 to Local Authorities to fund the creation of local arboretums as public places of remembrance in the aftermath of the current crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
As we emerge from a very long, dark tunnel, thought should now be given to how, as a nation, we can best:
•	mourn loved ones lost to the disease
•	recognise the heroism of so many who gave support, care, succour and sometimes their own lives to help others
•	reflect on the lessons we can learn as communities, and as society as a whole, on the frailty but also the strength and resilience of humankind.
•	celebrate the achievements of those who, with medical skill and dedication saw us emerge from the darkness.
What better way to do this than by planting trees? Symbols of the lasting relationship with our environment and providers of oxygen; a commodity that was so cruelly denied to those who died at the hands of this disease.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Ban Aminopyralid and Clopyralid herbicides to help protect the environment
attributes.background: These chemical weed killers are proving highly damaging to the environment in general and our food crops in particular. Growing evidence shows of the long term resilience of these toxic compounds in the ecosystem. They damage food crops and remain active in the soil for long periods.
attributes.additional_details: Getting individuals to give up weed killer use is very difficult. Experience has shown that Government action is the best and most effective way of getting dangerous substances banned and habits changed.
